content:
ActiveDirectorySchemaClass Class

In this Article

The ActiveDirectorySchemaClass class represents a schema class definition that is contained in the schema partition.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ActiveDirectorySchemaClass : IDisposable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ActiveDirectorySchemaClass

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Constructors summary

ActiveDirectorySchemaClass(DirectoryContext,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

Properties summary

AuxiliaryClasses

Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains the auxiliary classes of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
CommonName

Gets or sets the Common Name (CN) of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
DefaultObjectSecurityDescriptor

Gets or sets the default ActiveDirectorySecurity descriptor of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
Description

Gets or sets a description of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
IsDefunct

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object is defunct.
MandatoryProperties

Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection object that contains the properties that the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass must contain.
Name

Gets the ldapDisplayName of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object. For more information, see the topic LDAP-Display-Name in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com.
Oid

Gets or sets the OID for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
OptionalProperties

Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection object that contains the properties that the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass can contain.
PossibleInferiors

Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass objects that the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass class can contain.
PossibleSuperiors

Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass objects that can contain this class.
SchemaGuid

Gets or sets the schemaIDGUID for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object. For more information, see the topic "schemaIDGUID" or "Schema-ID-GUID" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
SubClassOf

Gets or sets the schema class from which the current ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object is derived.
Type

Gets or sets the SchemaClassType type for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

Methods summary

Dispose()

Releases the resources that are used by the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object and, optionally, releases unmanaged resources.
FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object in the Active Directory Domain Services schema partition that matches a given directory context and name.
GetAllProperties()

Gets a ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection collection that contains all properties, including ancestor properties, of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
GetDirectoryEntry()

Gets the DirectoryEntry object for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
Save()

Commits all changes to the current ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object to the underlying directory store.
ToString()

Gets the LDAP display name of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

Constructors

  • ActiveDirectorySchemaClass(DirectoryContext,String)

    Initializes a new instance of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public ActiveDirectorySchemaClass (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string ldapDisplayName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      An DirectoryContext object that specifies the context for this ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    • ldapDisplayName
      String

      A String that represents the LDAP display name for this ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      context does not refer to a valid Forest or ConfigurationSet, ldapDisplayName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or ldapDisplayName is null.

    Remarks

    The Save method must be called to commit the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object that was created to the underlying directory store.

Properties

  • AuxiliaryClasses

    Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains the auxiliary classes of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection AuxiliaryClasses { get; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection

      An ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains ActiveDirectorySchemaClass objects that represent the auxiliary classes of the current schema class object.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • CommonName

    Gets or sets the Common Name (CN) of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public string CommonName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that represents the CN of the current class object.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • DefaultObjectSecurityDescriptor

    Gets or sets the default ActiveDirectorySecurity descriptor of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurity DefaultObjectSecurityDescriptor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySecurity

      An ActiveDirectorySecurity object that represents the default security descriptor for the current schema class object.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • Description

    Gets or sets a description of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public string Description { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that contains a description of the current class object.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • IsDefunct

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object is defunct.

    public bool IsDefunct { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      A Boolean value that indicates if the current schema class object is defunct. true if the object is defunct; otherwise, false.

  • MandatoryProperties

    Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection object that contains the properties that the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass must contain.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection MandatoryProperties { get; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection

      An ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection object that contains the ActiveDirectorySchemaProperty objects that represent the properties that the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object must contain.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • Name

    Gets the ldapDisplayName of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object. For more information, see the topic LDAP-Display-Name in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com.

    public string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that contains the ldapDisplayName of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object. For more information, see the topic LDAP-Display-Name in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com.

  • Oid

    Gets or sets the OID for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public string Oid { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that represents the OID of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • OptionalProperties

    Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection object that contains the properties that the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass can contain.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection OptionalProperties { get; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection

      An ActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection object that contains the ActiveDirectorySchemaProperty objects that the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object can contain.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • PossibleInferiors

    Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass objects that the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass class can contain.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection PossibleInferiors { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection

      An ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass objects that this class can contain.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • PossibleSuperiors

    Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass objects that can contain this class.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection PossibleSuperiors { get; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection

      An ActiveDirectorySchemaClassCollection object that contains the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass objects that can contain this class.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • SchemaGuid

    Gets or sets the schemaIDGUID for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object. For more information, see the topic "schemaIDGUID" or "Schema-ID-GUID" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

    public Guid SchemaGuid { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Guid

      A Guid object that contains the schemaIDGUID for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object. For more information, see the topic "schemaIDGUID" or "Schema-ID-GUID" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    Remarks

    The SchemaGuid is used in many Active Directory Domain Services configuration operations, such as managing extended rights.

  • SubClassOf

    Gets or sets the schema class from which the current ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object is derived.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchemaClass SubClassOf { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySchemaClass

      An ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object that contains the schema class from which the current schema class is derived. null if no schema class was specified during the creation of the current class.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • Type

    Gets or sets the SchemaClassType type for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.SchemaClassType Type { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SchemaClassType

      A SchemaClassType value that contains the type of the current ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • InvalidEnumArgumentException

      The specified type is not a valid SchemaClassType value (applies to set only).

Methods

  • Dispose()

    Releases the resources that are used by the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public void Dispose ();
  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object and, optionally, releases unmanaged resources.

    protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true if the managed resources should be released; false if only the unmanaged resources should be released.

  • FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

    Gets an ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object in the Active Directory Domain Services schema partition that matches a given directory context and name.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchemaClass FindByName (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string ldapDisplayName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      An DirectoryContext object that specifies the context for the search.

    • ldapDisplayName
      String

      A String that specifies the LDAP display name of the schema class for the search.

    Returns

    • ActiveDirectorySchemaClass

      An ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object for the schema class that was found. Returns null if the class was not found.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      The object was not found.

    • ArgumentException

      context does not refer to a valid Forest or ConfigurationSet, ldapDisplayName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or ldapDisplayName is null.

  • GetAllProperties()

    Gets a ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection collection that contains all properties, including ancestor properties, of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection GetAllProperties ();

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection

      A ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection collection of the properties of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass, including ancestor properties.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    Remarks

    If the method is called on an unbound object instance, an empty ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection collection is returned.

  • GetDirectoryEntry()

    Gets the DirectoryEntry object for the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry GetDirectoryEntry ();

    Returns

    • DirectoryEntry

      A DirectoryEntry object that represents the directory entry for the schema class.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      The ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object is not a valid instance.

  • Save()

    Commits all changes to the current ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object to the underlying directory store.

    public void Save ();

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      The context is an AD LDS configuration set and the AD LDS instance could not be found.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

  • ToString()

    Gets the LDAP display name of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String that represents the LDAP display name of the ActiveDirectorySchemaClass object.
